conclusion: The task is to determine which blocks car A will collide with and where it will eventually stop, based on power, collision, and deflection effects.

The first image shows a small silver/green toy car labeled as 'A' with a red arrow, positioned at the right edge of a green surface. Various colored blocks (red, blue, orange, green, yellow, purple) are scattered on the surface.
The second image shows the car moving into the field of blocks and colliding with some red blocks in the middle-right area of the setup.
The third image shows the car further left, having pushed or knocked some red blocks along its path.
The third image also shows the car stopped in the left-central area of the scene, with some red blocks repositioned nearby.
The car had enough momentum to push through multiple blocks but eventually stopped after losing energy through collisions.
When the car hit blocks, it transferred energy to them, causing some (particularly the red ones) to move.
The car appears to have taken a somewhat curved path through the blocks, suggesting it was deflected slightly during collisions rather than continuing in a perfectly straight line.
The car eventually stopped among some red blocks on the left side of the scene, having exhausted its momentum through multiple collisions.
Car A collided primarily with red blocks in the middle of the setup, pushed or scattered these red blocks, and eventually came to rest on the left side of the scene near some displaced red blocks.
